item.content:encoded: Per Moody's, the top 10% of earners now account for nearly half of all spending in the United States. If only there was some policy that would allow us to diversify income and spending across a broader swath of Americans. Oh well. Guess capitalism just has to be this way.
item.author: Hal Singer

item.content:encoded: Former M&A Director of Constellation Software's on the deal sourcing process $csu "They have a database of around 70,000 or however many software companies. Basically, every software company in the world is included."

item.content:encoded: Spotify's advertising revenue grew by 7% (y/y) in Q4, compared to 17% for Meta, 14% for Snap, 14% for YouTube, and 18% for Pinterest. While the company does offer a pixel, it has struggled to activate it for effective targeting, given the specifics of the ad format.

item.content:encoded: Chegg CEO: Google‚Äôs AI Overviews have significantly impacted Chegg‚Äôs traffic, acquisitions & revenue "Our non- subscriber traffic plummeted to negative 49% in January 2025, down significantly from the modest 8% decline we reported in Q2 2024" $CHGG: -27% AH

item.content:encoded: Jitse buying GRUB and then thinking he could spend Uber Eats out of the UK with his German/Dutch profit pools has to be one of the craziest strategies of all time. January the first month where JET isn't #1 in the UK. Hard to believe.

item.content:encoded: Shifting from a pre-training centric world to an inference centric world is likely positive for compute overall. Intelligence may scale even better with test-time compute (inference) than it does with pre-training per the charts below. The balance of compute always had to move
item.author: Gavin Baker

item.content:encoded: I mentioned this last week, but now that Abel & his team have full reports out: the fraud is bad, but the fact that referees and editors did not question the totally implausible effect sizes from a tiny intervention is even worse. Needs a cultural change in development research.
item.author: Kevin A. Bryan

item.content:encoded: Sometimes what young people need is a mentor who tells them: you are special. you are different. destiny has something special in store for you. the young person may not fully believe it, and the mentor may not either, but something special comes out of externally injected faith
item.author: alz

item.content:encoded:
The easiest life hack: Be kind to customer support reps
They get yelled at literally all day b/c 1) most companies don't respect their customers 2) make it hard to reach a human
They have many tools to help you if you're kind. Will save you thousands, and lots of headaches
